definition: (lit.) land of fish and rice/(fig.) fertile region/land of milk and honey
surname Yu
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
surname Mi
rice/CL:粒[li4]/meter (classifier)
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)

sentences.english: It is located in the beautiful Tongxiang City, Zhejiang Province, on a rich plain praised as "homeland of fish and rice".
sentences.chinese: 地址坐落在环境秀美的“鱼米之乡”浙江省桐乡市。

sentences.english: This area enjoys the reputation of a land with milk and honey.
sentences.chinese: 这个地方有鱼米之乡的美誉。

sentences.english: Wuhu is a land of fish and rice. So are other places in this region.
sentences.chinese: 芜湖是鱼米之乡，该地区的其他地方也是。

sentences.english: Wuxi is a famous land of plenty.
sentences.chinese: 无锡是中国著名的鱼米之乡。

sentences.english: Hunan is a land of fish and rice.
sentences.chinese: 基本资料湖南是鱼米之乡。

sentences.english: I clearly remember that it is a land of fish and rice.
sentences.chinese: 我清楚记得，那是一个鱼米之乡。

sentences.english: The province is traditionally known as the "Land of Fish and Rice".
sentences.chinese: 浙江省在传统上被称为“鱼米之乡”。

sentences.english: Qingpu, a land of fish and rice, lies in the west suburbs of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 青浦是一个鱼米之乡，位于上海的西郊。

sentences.english: Jingjiang is a famous land flowing with milk and honey.
sentences.chinese: 靖江是著名的鱼米之乡。

sentences.english: Hunan is a good district with abundant fish and rice.
sentences.chinese: “湖南是鱼米之乡”用英文怎么说？

sentences.english: The area is known as "the land of fish and rice".
sentences.chinese: 这个地区是有名的鱼米之乡。

definition: patchwork of waterways, esp. in Jiangsu/same as 江南水鄉|江南水乡[Jiang1 nan2 shui3 xiang1]
illustrious hero, spirit of the place (idiom); a place derives reflected glory from an illustrious son
populous and affluent
fertile/richly provided
patchwork of waterways, esp. in Jiangsu
food growing area
lit. there is heaven above, and there is 蘇杭|苏杭[Su1 Hang2] below (idiom)/fig. the beauty and affluence of Suzhou and Hangzhou is comparable with heaven
pinyin: shang4 you3 tian1 tang2 , xia4 you3 Su1 Hang2

definition: lit. head in Wu and tail in Chu (idiom); fig. close together/head-to-tail/one thing starts where the other leaves off

south of Changjiang or Yangtze river/south of the lower reaches of Changjiang/often refers to south Jiangsu, south Anhui and north Zhejiang provinces/a province during Qing times/in literature, refers to the sunny south/Gangnam (district in Seoul, South Korea)
land of plenty/Heavenly province (epithet of Sichuan, esp. area around Chengdu)
Yangtze River Delta
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
alluvial plain
to produce in abundance/to be rich in
lit. verdant hills and limpid water (idiom)/fig. enchanting scenery
fame/good reputation/famous for sth
